title: Shyam Benegal dies: Akshay Kumar, Manoj Bajpayee and Shekhar Kapur mourn demise of veteran filmmaker, call him 'legend' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Shyam Benegal dies: Akshay Kumar, Manoj Bajpayee and Shekhar Kapur mourn demise of veteran filmmaker, call him 'legend'

Date: December 23, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Shyam Benegal, celebrated Indian filmmaker, passed away on December 23 at the age of 90. His death has prompted an outpouring of tributes from Bollywood celebrities who remembered him as a legend and visionary in Indian cinema.

  • Benegal had recently celebrated his 90th birthday.
  • He was known for his pioneering work in Indian parallel cinema.
  • His daughter confirmed his passing, citing the great loss it represents.
  • He won multiple National Awards and was honored with Padma Shri and Padma Bhushan.
“Pained to know of Shyam Benegal ji’s demise. One of the finest filmmakers in our country, truly a legend. Om Shanti.” - Akshay Kumar
“A heartbreaking loss for Indian cinema...his legacy will live on in the stories he told and the lives he touched.” - Manoj Bajpayee

Benegal's influence on Indian cinema is celebrated widely, and his legacy as a storyteller will continue to inspire future generations.
newTitle: Shyam Benegal dies: Tributes from Bollywood stars

title: Pushpa 2 Hindi Box Office Day 19 Early Trends: History Has Been Created, Allu Arjun Inaugurates 700 Crore Club! - Koimoi
summary:
Pushpa 2 Hindi Box Office Day 19 Early Trends: History Has Been Created, Allu Arjun Inaugurates 700 Crore Club

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Koimoi

Ahead of the Christmas vacation and New Year festivity, Pushpa 2 (Hindi) is setting itself to explode like anything at the Indian box office. After enjoying the rush for 18 straight days, it was expected to slow down on the third Monday, but it remains strong, flirting with the 10 crore mark and creating history by becoming the first Hindi film to enter the 700 crore club.

  • Pushpa 2 has broken numerous records in Hindi cinema.
  • It surpassed Stree 2’s collection of 627.50 crores to become the highest-grossing Hindi film.
  • The film maintained strong occupancy rates despite weekend fluctuations.
  • Day 19 projections suggest earnings between 9-10 crores.
  • Total box office collection so far lies between 701.50-702.50 crores.
“Allu Arjun has inaugurated the 700 crore club.”

This remarkable performance indicates potential future earnings, possibly setting the stage for the next milestone in Hindi film collections.
newTitle: Pushpa 2 Hindi Box Office Day 19: Allu Arjun Enters 700 Crore Club

The producers of Pushpa 2 have contributed Rs 50 lakhs to aid the family of a victim who lost their life in a recent stampede during promotional events related to the film. This act of philanthropy aims to support the family in their time of grief and hardship.

title: Who Is Behind Tarnishing NTR‘s Image? - M9
summary:
Who Is Behind Tarnishing NTR‘s Image?

Source: M9 News

In recent news, a woman has publicly accused actor NTR of failing to fulfill a promise to help with her son's medical treatment. This has sparked discussions on social media about NTR's charitable commitments.

  • A woman claimed NTR promised to help her critically ill son but did not provide any financial support.
  • During a video call, NTR expressed willingness to assist without specifying an amount.
  • NTR fans contributed to the child's healthcare costs, amounting to 20 Lakhs.
  • The allegations have led to negative publicity and trolling of NTR on social platforms.

“Charity is always a choice and cannot be demanded.”

title: Shyam Benegal, a giant of Indian cinema, passes away at 90 - The Hindu
summary:
Shyam Benegal, a Giant of Indian Cinema, Passes Away at 90

Date & Source: December 23, 2024 - The Hindu

Filmmaker Shyam Benegal, a towering figure in Indian cinema and a leading force behind the Parallel Cinema movement, has passed away at the age of 90 due to kidney-related ailments in Mumbai.

  • Benegal was renowned for his impactful films such as Ankur, Nishant, Mandi, Manthan, and Zubeidaa.
  • He addressed critical social issues, including feudalism and women’s rights, and experimented with cinematic form.
  • His daughter confirmed his death, citing chronic kidney disease as the cause.
  • Naseeruddin Shah expressed deep gratitude for Benegal’s mentorship and support throughout his career.
  • He directed notable biopics and received numerous accolades including the Padma Shri and Padma Bhushan.
“It is impossible to describe in a few words what Shyam meant to me.” - Naseeruddin Shah

Shyam Benegal's legacy will continue to inspire future filmmakers and audiences around the world.
newTitle: Shyam Benegal, a Giant of Indian Cinema, Passes Away at 90

title: Pushpa 2 The Rule stampede: Producer of Allu Arjun film donates ₹50 lakh to victim's family - Hindustan Times
summary:
Pushpa 2 The Rule Stampede: Producer Donates ₹50 Lakh to Victim's Family

Publication Date: Dec 23, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The producer of the film Pushpa 2, Naveen Yerneni, has donated ₹50 lakh to the family of a victim who lost her life in a tragic stampede during the film's premiere.

  • Allu Arjun had previously donated ₹25 lakh to the same family.
  • Director Sukumar contributed ₹5 lakh to the victim's family.
  • The stampede occurred on the premiere eve, resulting in the death of a woman and critical injuries to her young son.
  • Naveen Yerneni expressed his condolences and commitment to support the victim's family.
  • In a response to the incident, Allu Arjun's residence was vandalised, leading to police action.
"It's very unfortunate what happened. Revathi's death is a huge loss to her family." - Naveen Yerneni

This tragedy has sparked controversy and highlighted the responsibilities of those involved in large public events. The attention from the media and the public is likely to continue as the impacts of the incident unfold.
newTitle: Pushpa 2 The Rule Stampede: Producer Donates ₹50 Lakh to Victim's Family

title: ‘Don’t mess with the OG’ – AP Dhillon-Diljit Dosanjh feud heats up as fans pick sides - ThePrint
summary:
‘Don’t mess with the OG’ – AP Dhillon-Diljit Dosanjh feud heats up as fans pick sides

Publication Date: New Delhi

AP Dhillon and Diljit Dosanjh are embroiled in a heated online feud, igniting passionate responses from fans on both sides. The exchange began following a shoutout from Diljit during his concert.

Key Points:

  • Diljit praised AP Dhillon and Karan Aujla during his concert, leading to Dhillon's response about being blocked on Instagram.
  • Dhillon shared that he has remained out of controversies, questioning Diljit's online interactions.
  • Dosanjh denied ever blocking Dhillon, amidst the social media uproar.
  • Badshah advised both artists to stay united, emphasizing the importance of collaboration over rivalry.
  • Dhillon recently took to the stage to address the rumors, emphasizing their friendship while mocking the narrative pushed by social media.
  • The feud indicates a divide in fan support, with some criticizing Dhillon and others defending him.

Notable Quotes:

“If this social media did not exist then you people would not have become such big artists.” - Anonymous user on social media
“This social media is all corrupt... we f***ing love each other.” - AP Dhillon

The unfolding conflict reflects not only personal rivalries but also broader themes within the Punjabi music scene, showcasing the influence of social media on artists' relationships.
newTitle: AP Dhillon and Diljit Dosanjh's Feud Intensifies Online as Fans Take Sides

title: Shyam Benegal, India's Parallel Cinema Pioneer, Dies At 90 - NDTV Movies
summary:
Shyam Benegal, India's Parallel Cinema Pioneer, Dies At 90

Publication Date: December 15, 2023

Source: PTI

Shyam Benegal, a seminal figure in Indian parallel cinema, passed away at the age of 90 in Mumbai, leaving a significant legacy in filmmaking known for realism and social commentary.

  • Shyam Benegal died on December 14, 2023, after suffering from chronic kidney disease.
  • He was hospitalized in the intensive care unit at Wockhardt Hospital just days after his 90th birthday.
  • His daughter confirmed that he had been ill for several years but was still working on multiple projects.
  • Benegal's last film was the biographical 'Mujib: The Making of a Nation' released in 2023.
  • Known for classic films like 'Bhumika', 'Manthan', and 'Junoon', he is a pivotal figure in Hindi cinema.
“I'm working on two to three projects; they are all different from one another.” - Shyam Benegal on his 90th birthday.

Shyam Benegal's contributions to parallel cinema have left an indelible mark on Indian culture, promoting realism and important social issues through his work.
newTitle: Shyam Benegal, India's Parallel Cinema Pioneer, Dies At 90

summary:

SS Rajamouli's RRR, featuring NTR and Ram Charan, has regained the glory of Indian cinema post-COVID, winning awards including an Oscar. The documentary “RRR Behind and Beyond” celebrating its making will stream on Netflix starting December 27.

  • Highlights include making clips of Charan’s introduction and the viral song sequence.
  • Netizens have praised the team's hard work and cinematic efforts.
“RRR Behind and Beyond” will reach a wide audience on Netflix.

This documentary showcases the efforts behind RRR and is set to introduce its cinematic journey to an even broader audience via streaming.

title: Shyam Benegal, the force behind India’s parallel cinema movement, dies at 90 - The Indian Express
summary:
Shyam Benegal, Pioneering Director of India's Parallel Cinema, Passes Away at 90

Publication Date: [Date Not Provided], Source: The Indian Express

Shyam Benegal, a key figure in India's parallel cinema movement, known for his impactful storytelling and social realism, has passed away at the age of 90.

  • Benegal debuted with the film Ankur in 1974, which criticized the caste system and was well-received.
  • He directed notable works including Nishant, Manthan, and the television series Bharat Ek Khoj.
  • His films featured strong, independent female characters and pushed the boundaries of Indian cinema.
  • Despite initial criticism, he remained a significant voice in the film industry, adapting to and experimenting with various themes and formats throughout his career.
“I think I have never been in the habit of repeating myself, and that’s what keeps it interesting for me.” - Shyam Benegal

Benegal's contributions to cinema not only shaped the parallel movement but also left a lasting impact on Indian storytelling and culture.
newTitle: Shyam Benegal, Pioneering Director of India's Parallel Cinema, Passes Away at 90

title: Filmmaker Shyam Benegal passes away - The Indian Express
summary:
Shyam Benegal, the Force Behind India's Parallel Cinema Movement, Dies at 90

Publication Date: Recent, Source: Indian Express

Shyam Benegal, a pioneering figure in India's parallel cinema movement, passed away at the age of 90, leaving behind a legacy of impactful films and television shows.

  • Benegal made his debut with the acclaimed film Ankur in 1974, critiquing social issues in India.
  • He directed several landmark films such as Nishant, Manthan, and Bhumika.
  • His body of work includes significant television series like Bharat Ek Khoj.
  • Benegal introduced assertive female characters and showcased the talents of actors like Naseeruddin Shah and Shabana Azmi.
  • Despite facing criticism, he continued to create meaningful cinema until his late career.
“Shyam Benegal’s movies and aesthetics played a major role in the parallel cinema movement of the 70s and 80s.”

His films remain influential and relevant, impacting both audiences and subsequent filmmakers.
newTitle: Shyam Benegal, the Force Behind India's Parallel Cinema Movement, Dies at 90

Date: December 2024 | Source: The Indian Express

After nearly four months since their daughter’s arrival, Bollywood actors Ranveer Singh and Deepika Padukone hosted an event to introduce their daughter, Dua, to the paparazzi.

  • This was the couple's first public appearance since their daughter’s birth in September.

  • Deepika wore a beautiful beige long dress, and Ranveer donned a white co-ord set.
  • Ranveer was seen affectionately kissing Deepika on the cheek during the event.

title: Pushpa 2 Box Office Collection Day 19: Allu Arjun's film earns ₹12.25 crore | Check total collection | Today News - Mint
summary:
Pushpa 2 Box Office Collection Day 19: Allu Arjun’s Film Earns ₹12.25 Crore

Date: December 23, 2024 Source: Live Mint

Pushpa 2: The Rule has made remarkable earnings at the box office, collecting ₹12.25 crore net on its 19th day of release.

  • The film has achieved an overall domestic gross of ₹1074.85 crore.
  • During its third weekend, it made a total of ₹57.7 crore net.
  • It crossed the ₹50 crore mark in its third weekend, maintaining its position as a top choice for moviegoers.
  • Worldwide, the film grossed ₹1506.70 crore in 18 days, with ₹240 crore coming from overseas.
  • To become the second-biggest Indian grosser, it needs about ₹280 crores more.
“#Pushpa2 crosses the ₹50 cr mark in Weekend 3, which is absolutely fantastic…” — Taran Adarsh

Overall, Pushpa 2 continues to perform strongly, with significant implications for its worldwide box office rankings.
newTitle: Pushpa 2 Box Office Collection Day 19: Allu Arjun’s Film Earns ₹12.25 Crore

Ranveer Singh and Deepika Padukone have introduced their baby daughter Dua to the paparazzi after keeping her away from the limelight since her birth on September 8, 2024.

  • Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh welcomed their daughter Dua, meaning Prayer, on September 8, 2024.
  • The couple organized a small celebration to introduce Dua to select paparazzi, with a condition that no pictures of her would be taken.
  • Ranveer expressed immense joy in welcoming 'laxmi' into their home during the gathering.
  • Deepika made her first public appearance post-birth at a concert in Bangalore, emphasizing her commitment to motherhood.
  • The actress is expected to resume work soon with upcoming projects like Kalki 2898 AD part 2.

Pushpa 2: The Rule continues to dominate the box office, becoming the third highest-grossing Indian film of all time with a worldwide collection exceeding Rs 1600 crore.

  • Allu Arjun stars in the sequel, reprising his role as Pushpa Raj.
  • The film has surpassed Baahubali 2 and Dangal, which are the only ones to gross higher.
  • It has been well-received by critics and audiences alike.
  • The film's competition includes the upcoming release Baby John.
  • Pushpa 2's duration of 3 hours and 20 minutes has received mixed reviews.
“Pushpa 2 will now face competition from Varun Dhawan's action-packed drama Baby John.”

The film marks a notable achievement in Indian cinema, setting the stage for its upcoming sequel, Pushpa 3: The Rampage.
